author: Fuseworks Media
title: Council contributes to Enderley clean-up
text:
Friday, 16 October, 2015 - 13:03 
Two Hamilton City Council business units will provide support to a community event in Enderley this weekend. 
The Enderley Clean-up Day has been organised by Community Link as part of the organisation’s month-long focus on voluntary work in the community. 
Teams will work in walkways in the Enderley/Fairfield area, picking up rubbish, removing vegetation (primarily weed plants), and painting over grafitti or larger painting tidy-up jobs. 
Hamilton City Council’s Tagbusters team will provide painting materials for the walkways, and City Parks will supply rubbish bags and take away the waste collected. 
The day culminates with a sausage sizzle at the Council-owned Enderley Park Community Centre. 
The event starts at 10.30am, and is expected to conclude about 1pm.
